name: Hotel de Goezeput

reviews.title: Had deteriorated from our last stay.
reviews.text: When we stayed at this family-run hotel previously in summer '96, it was comfortable, clean and reasonably priced and convenient being in the Old Town and not far from anywhere. However, this time it had recently been taken over by new people and although they had added a bar in the dining room and modernised this area somewhat, the bedrooms were badly in need of refurbishing and looked quite neglected and worn.

My friend and I found this lovely hotel simply by wandering around Brugge. The hotel has a great "common room" where they have several board games available. We were here a week or so before Christmas, and playing games by the cheery fire with a Belgian beer was a wonderful way to spend an hour or so away from the cold.
reviews.title: Beautiful Little Hotel, Fantastic Location

likes.disliked: — Our stay was great--no complaints whatsoever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the top floor, a double for which we paid about 75 euro. The room had gorgeous wooden beams all throughout the ceiling, and a skylight which afforded an unbeatable view of the Cathedral.
reviews.title: Good for its price

reviews.text: The hotel is simple in decor, but clean and comfortable. The absolute best part of the hotel is its location. It is nicely situated between both the Cathedral and the Church of Our Lady on a quiet residential street. The staff was incredible: always willing to offer directions or to answer any questions.
reviews.title: great for a short stay

likes.disliked: — shower wasn't great as older room

reviews.text: Breakfast was included with the cost of our room and usually consisted of toast, pastry, yogurt, fruit, coffee, tea or juice.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Would definately stay here again the next time I am in Brugge.
reviews.title: Does 2 star mean lack of cleanliness?

description: The ideal spot for getting to know Bruges and its inhabitants. Recommended by "The Rough Guide" and "Le Guide du Routard". Karel will give you a friendly welcome to the charming family hotel "De Goezeput," located in an 18th century monastery. He recently renovated the ground floor to create a modern bar-salon where the local inhabitants of Bruges also like to drop in for a drink and a chat. We will offer you a pleasant stay and warm hospitality in a delightful setting. The hotel is situated in the historic center between the Cathedral and the Our Lady church, just a 5 minutes walk from the Market Square and close to all the main touristic spots and museums of Bruges. It is the perfect base for exploring all aspects of the city of which we are so proud. - Modern lounge with cosy fireplace - Terrace - Free internet + Wireless LAN - All rooms have television and a private bathroom with toilet. - Children under the age of 3 stay for free in their parents room. Bar: Monday - Thursday open until 9 pm Friday and Sunday 11 pm Saturday evening closed. PARKING: you can park the car in the guarded parking which is situated to the left of the front of the railway station. Cost: 2.50 euro/24h. The hotel is only a 10 minute walk from the station.
